examples: make a photo of the man driving the car down the california coastline
prompt.title: Prompt

resolution.title: Resolution
resolution.description: The resolution of the image to generate.

enable_web_search.title: Enable Web Search
enable_web_search.description: Enable web search for the image generation task. This will allow the model to use the latest information from the web to generate the image.

num_images.title: Number of Images
num_images.description: The number of images to generate.

aspect_ratio.title: Aspect Ratio
aspect_ratio.description: The aspect ratio of the generated image.

output_format.title: Output Format
output_format.description: The format of the generated image.

sync_mode.title: Sync Mode
sync_mode.description: If `True`, the media will be returned as a data URI and the output data won't be available in the request history.

safety_tolerance.title: Safety Tolerance
safety_tolerance.description: The safety tolerance level for content moderation. 1 is the most strict (blocks most content), 6 is the least strict.

seed.title: Seed
seed.description: The seed for the random number generator.

limit_generations.title: Limit Generations
limit_generations.description: Experimental parameter to limit the number of generations from each round of prompting to 1. Set to `True` to to disregard any instructions in the prompt regarding the number of images to generate and ignore any intermediate images generated by the model. This may affect generation quality.

image_urls.title: Image URLs
image_urls.description: The URLs of the images to use for image-to-image generation or image editing.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of the generated images.

file_size.title: File Size
file_size.description: The size of the file in bytes.

file_name.title: File Name
file_name.description: The name of the file. It will be auto-generated if not provided.

content_type.title: Content Type
content_type.description: The mime type of the file.

url.title: Url
url.description: The URL where the file can be downloaded from.
